*Hypoxaemia with normo or hypocapnia (increase in the alveolar-arterial difference)
**Diseases of the pulmonary exchanger (see above)
*predominantly alveolar hypoventilation
**Diseases of the ventilatory pump
*COPD is above all a disease of the exchanger with hypoxaemia and normo/hypocapnia initially. At a later stage, alveolar hypoventilation may appear in the most severe patients.

question.title: What is the primary mechanism responsible for hypoxaemia in patients with COPD?

option_a.title: Alveolar hypoventilation
option_a.description: A condition where the lungs are not ventilating properly

option_b.title: Diseases of the pulmonary exchanger
option_b.description: A condition where the lungs' gas exchange mechanism is impaired

option_c.title: Circulatory failure
option_c.description: A condition where the body's circulatory system is not functioning properly

option_d.title: Respiratory failure
option_d.description: A condition where the body's respiratory system is not functioning properly

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the answer
